definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: This thesis reviews the background of tax barriers and customs of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 本文考察了太平天国税关与海关的设立背景。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important for the research of the Taiping Heavenly Kindom to research waterborne forces of Hunan Army.
sentences.chinese: 考察湘军水师于是成为研究太平天国史的重要课题。

sentences.english: We know that the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom Church of God and prayer are closely related.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道，太平天国与拜上帝教息息相关。

sentences.english: The problem of the red-bill ships has been one the t…
sentences.chinese: 红单船问题是太平天国史上很值得研究的课题之一。

sentences.english: In 1852 the Taiping forces laid a siege on Changsha.
sentences.chinese: 1852年太平天国部队奠定了围困长沙。

sentences.english: The Government of the Qing Dynasty collaborated with foreign reactionary forces to crush down the peasant uprising of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 清朝政府勾结外国反动势力镇压太平天国农民起义。

sentences.english: It's believed that they're the remains of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 据说它们是太平天国留下的。

sentences.english: The problem of the red-bill ships has be…
sentences.chinese: 红单船问题是太平天国史上很值得研究的课题之一。

sentences.english: He joined the Taiping Heavenly Kingdomat 16 and later was named the Wing King.
sentences.chinese: 十六岁加入太平天国，后被封为翼王。

definition: Hong Xiuquan or Hung Hsiu-ch'üan (1814-1864), leader of the Taiping rebellion or Taiping Heavenly Kingdom
Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
Nian Army, leading a peasant rebellion against the Qing dynasty in Shandong, Henan, Jiangsu and Anhui 1851-1868, at the same time as the Taiping Rebellion further south
the Qing court (as government of China)
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
Yang Xiuqing (1821-1856), organizer and commander-in-chief of the Taiping Rebellion
Zeng Guofan (1811-1872), Qing dynasty politician and military man
anti-Qing/refers to the revolutionary movements in late 19th and early 20th century leading up to 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4]
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
Wuchang Uprising of October 10th, 1911, which led to Sun Yat-sen's Xinhai Revolution and the fall of the Qing dynasty
